title: Access POS when System Down
Can't Scan Barcodes
NETS Card terminal not working
text: NETS Card terminal not working Monday, 3 October 2022 09.29 Example startup complete: WIP Once you have the startup complete receipt you can troubleshoot the card terminal. If you don’t have one, restart the connector. If ECR is red on the display on the cardterminal. Step 1: Restart connector to get a start-up complete receipt. Step 2: Find the Merchant card on the bottom of the cardterminal Step 3: Swipe Merchant card Step 4: Press 6 Step 5: Press 1 Step 6: Press 2 Step 7: Press the arrow beneath the display on the cardterminal until it says "komm. type" Step 8: Press the green button Swipe the merchant card through the terminal, it's usually at the back of the terminal. Press 6-1-2 and then press the arrows beneath the display on the terminal until it says "Komm. type". Press the green button to edit and press the arrows again until it says "Ethernet" then confirm with green. Then press red button once and then 3 for "Kasse" and then press the arrows again until the screen shows the option "Komm. type". Press the green button to edit and then the arrows until it says "IP Ethernet". Press the green button. Then press the arrows until it says 'ECR IP adresse' If the IP address on the display corresponds to the startup recipe and a restart of connector and terminal have been done then the issue lies elsewhere. Proceed to section 2 for further troubleshoot otherwise proceed below. If not then press the green button to edit. If there's already numbers here press yellow to delete that. Now you need to insert the IP address that is on your startup recipe. The IP format is "XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX" (192.168.100.199). If there is only 1 or 2 numbers in the IP then you need to add an extra 0's. Eg. "002.010.001.050" Enter the numbers as shown on the startup complete receipt. When you have inserted the correct IP address press the Red 'STOP' button twice. The card terminal will now reboot. Wait 1 minute and then restart the connector, after a few minutes, the 'ECR' should turn green. Section 2
description:
NETS Card terminal not working

Monday, 3 October 2022

09.29

Example startup complete:

WIP

 

Once you have the startup complete receipt you can troubleshoot the card terminal.

If you don’t have one, restart the connector.

 

If ECR is red on the display on the cardterminal.

 

Step 1: Restart connector to get a start-up complete receipt.

Step 2: Find the Merchant card on the bottom of the cardterminal

Step 3: Swipe Merchant card

Step 4: Press 6

Step 5: Press 1

Step 6: Press 2

Step 7: Press the arrow beneath the display on the cardterminal until it says "komm. type"

Step 8: Press the green button

 

  1. Swipe the merchant card through the terminal, it's usually at the back of the terminal. 

 

  1. Press 6-1-2 and then press the arrows beneath the display on the terminal until it says "Komm. type". 
      
  2. Press the green button to edit and press the arrows again until it says "Ethernet" then confirm with green.

 

  1. Then press red button once and then 3 for "Kasse" and then press the arrows again until the screen shows the option "Komm. type".
      
  2. Press the green button to edit and then the arrows until it says "IP Ethernet". Press the green button.

 

  1. Then press the arrows until it says 'ECR IP adresse'
      

If the IP address on the display corresponds to the startup recipe and a restart of connector and terminal have been done then the issue lies elsewhere.

 

Proceed to section 2 for further troubleshoot otherwise proceed below.

 

  1. If not then press the green button to edit.
      
  2. If there's already numbers here press yellow to delete that.
      
  3. Now you need to insert the IP address that is on your startup recipe.

 

The IP format is "XXX.XXX.XXX.XXX" (192.168.100.199).

If there is only 1 or 2 numbers in the IP then you need to add an extra 0's. Eg. "002.010.001.050"

Enter the numbers as shown on the startup complete receipt.

 

When you have inserted the correct IP address press the Red 'STOP' button twice. 

The card terminal will now reboot.

 

Wait 1 minute and then restart the connector, after a few minutes, the 'ECR' should turn green.

 

Section 2

title: Clear Cache
text: Clear Cache Method 1: Step1: press Ctrl+Shift+i. Step2: Righ click the "update arrow" Step3: Choose Empty Cache and Hard Reload Method 2: Step 1: Go to the options page Step 2: Find "More Tools" Step 3: Select "Clear Browsing Data" Step 4: Click Clear Data (DO NOT delete passwords and other sign-in data) Step 5: Close the browser and start again Method 3 If the Ctrl+Shift+i does not work for some reason, you can open Tools -> More tools -> Developer tools -> and then press and hold the Reload key to Empty Cache and Hard Reload.
description:
Clear Cache

 

Method 1: 

Step1: press Ctrl+Shift+i. 

Step2: Righ click the "update arrow" 

Step3: Choose Empty Cache and Hard Reload

 

 

Method 2: 

Step 1: Go to the options page

Step 2: Find "More Tools"

Step 3: Select "Clear Browsing Data"

 

 

Step 4: Click Clear Data (DO NOT delete passwords and other sign-in data)

Step 5: Close the browser and start again

 

Method 3

If the Ctrl+Shift+i does not work for some reason, you can open Tools -> More tools -> Developer tools -> and then press and hold the Reload key to Empty Cache and Hard Reload.

title: Companion App - Difference Between App and Browser
text: Difference Between App and Browser Wednesday, 8 February 2023 15:19 The reason it is more effective to run the Companion as a PWA (app) is because it creates a shortcut on the device desktop which is easier to access and runs full screen, and is usually always logged in. Running it in the browser means that the user has full access to browser controls, like the browser back button (which will behave differently to the back buttons in-app), the address bar (which means they could browse away from the app without noticing and wonder what has gone wrong) or clear local storage (which would impact offline capabilities amongst other things as well as log them out). These factors mean that when running the software on a large number of devices, for which we do not have remote control access for it would be very difficult for us to control and support. We should not get a support ticket for example because they pressed the browser back button which caused them to lose their stocktake counts.
description:
Difference Between App and Browser

Wednesday, 8 February 2023

15:19

 

The reason it is more effective to run the Companion as a PWA (app) is because it creates a shortcut on the device desktop which is easier to access and runs full screen, and is usually always logged in.

 

Running it in the browser means that the user has full access to browser controls, like the browser back button (which will behave differently to the back buttons in-app), the address bar (which means they could browse away from the app without noticing and wonder what has gone wrong) or clear local storage (which would impact offline capabilities amongst other things as well as log them out).

 

These factors mean that when running the software on a large number of devices, for which we do not have remote control access for it would be very difficult for us to control and support. We should not get a support ticket for example because they pressed the browser back button which caused them to lose their stocktake counts.

title: Customer display on 2nd monitor
text: Customer display on 2nd monitor 06 October 2022 12:12 If the customer would like the customer display to be automatically on the correct monitor when starting up you could do the following: First click on any empty spot on your desktop and click on Display Settings. Identify which monitor is your customer display and remember this for later. Go to POS ADMIN > POS Options > Customer Display > And select either monitor 1 or 2 (or higher) depending which one is your customer display.
description:
Customer display on 2nd monitor

06 October 2022

12:12

 

If the customer would like the customer display to be automatically on the correct monitor when starting up you could do the following:

 

First click on any empty spot on your desktop and click on Display Settings. 

 

Identify which monitor is your customer display and remember this for later.

 

Go to POS ADMIN > POS Options > Customer Display > And select either monitor 1 or 2 (or higher) depending which one is your customer display.

title: Diagnosing P400 Ped asking for merchant Login
text: Diagnosing P400 Ped asking for merchant Login issues 24 August 2022 16:19 Diagnosing P400 merchant Login Required issues in Imagine Normally when there are issues regarding the new P400 ped displaying the message “Merchant Login Required” a complete power cycle of both the ped and the Connector will resolve this as the login information should be sent automatically to the Ped by the Connector. Also doing a clear cache of the browser will clear any Card terminal transaction flags that may be stuck. The Login information cannot be entered manually by keypress on the Ped. If this doesn’t work then some debugging will be required in order to find out if the Ped is indeed on the network and responds to a ping. Firstly some details about the Ped need to be obtained from the customers Imagine setup. Login to the customers Tenant normally one setup for k3 access can be found in the Tenant users list. For our customer Courtauld galleries this would be Courtauldgalleryk3admin the password is Password1! Use the Portal Admin/Connector manager Module to display the details as below. This will give you the IP address of the relevant Ped which you want to check returns a ping. Remote onto a machine on the customers local area network (preferably the Till) and open a command prompt and do a ping to the IP address of the Ped. If this returns a reply then we know the Ped is on the network. If this doesn’t return a reply then it’s time to contact the customer and advise them to have the network connection checked on the Ped and then retry the power cycling of both Ped and Connector again to check that it logs in ok automatically. If it still doesn’t work go to next step. Run Dev Tools (F12) whilst the Pos is at login screen and select “Network” tab then select Config?Posid Header and check Response. (see below) The local IP address for the connector can be found here. If there are more than 1 Pos on the network make sure the Pos that you are remoted on to and the Terminal IP and connector mac address match as in the connector manager setup shown previously. Copy over the Putty.exe app (it may already be on their desktop) if you did connector training then you will already have this. Run Putty and fill in the IP of the Connector as shown below and make an SSH connection to the connector IP. Login to the connector using pirate and password l2k0110team Once logged in run these commands to display the P400 logs which will determine if the Ped has a stuck transaction. cd compose docker logs compose_k3pay_1 If you see information like below then the Ped will have a stuck transaction and have to be returned to Verifone and a replacement arranged accordingly with Verifone. Best to email them at Ocius.customer.services@Verifone.com the details of the Ped by asking the customer for the SN on the back of the Ped and the Merchant account ID which is in the Connector Manager Pic above. Also send them a screenshot of the log.
description:
Diagnosing P400 Ped asking for merchant Login issues

24 August 2022

16:19

 

Diagnosing P400 merchant Login Required issues in Imagine

 

Normally when there are issues regarding the new P400 ped displaying the message “Merchant Login Required” a complete power cycle of both the ped and the Connector will resolve this as the login information should be sent automatically to the Ped by the Connector. Also doing a clear cache of the browser will clear any Card terminal transaction flags that may be stuck. The Login information cannot be entered manually by keypress on the Ped. 

 

If this doesn’t work then some debugging will be required in order to find out if the Ped is indeed on the network and responds to a ping.

 

Firstly some details about the Ped need to be obtained from the customers Imagine setup.

 

    1. Login to the customers Tenant normally one setup for k3 access can be found in the Tenant users list. For our customer Courtauld galleries this would be Courtauldgalleryk3admin the password is Password1!

 

Use the Portal Admin/Connector manager Module to display the details as below.

 

This will give you the IP address of the relevant Ped which you want to check returns a ping.

 

    1. Remote onto a machine on the customers local area network (preferably the Till) and open a command prompt and do a ping to the IP address of the Ped.

If this returns a reply then we know the Ped is on the network. If this doesn’t return a reply then it’s time to contact the customer and advise them to have the network connection checked on the Ped and then retry the power cycling of both Ped and Connector again to check that it logs in ok automatically. If it still doesn’t work go to next step.

 

Run Dev Tools (F12) whilst the Pos is at login screen and select “Network” tab then select Config?Posid Header and check Response. (see below)

 

The local IP address for the connector can be found here.

 

 

 

If there are more than 1 Pos on the network make sure the Pos that you are remoted on to and the Terminal IP and connector mac address match as in the connector manager setup shown previously. 

 

 

 

 Copy over the Putty.exe app (it may already be on their desktop) if you did connector training then you will already have this.

 

Run Putty and fill in the IP of the Connector as shown below and make an SSH connection to the connector IP.

Login to the connector using pirate and password l2k0110team

 

 

Once logged in run these commands to display the P400 logs which will determine if the Ped has a stuck transaction.

 

cd compose <enter>

docker logs compose_k3pay_1 <enter>

 

If you see information like below then the Ped will have a stuck transaction and have to be returned to Verifone and a replacement arranged accordingly with Verifone.

 

 

 

Best to email them at Ocius.customer.services@Verifone.com 

 

the details of the Ped by asking the customer for the SN on the back of the Ped and the Merchant account ID which is in the Connector Manager Pic above. Also send them a screenshot of the log.

title: Display of sizes and colors in stock widget
text: Display of sizes and colors in stock widget Tuesday, 21 February 2023 10:32 In case the customer reports that the POS doesn't show the color and sizes correctly in the stock widget The settings of the dimension template for the products needs to be checked in Imagine Inventory --> Itemoverview --> Matrix --> Dimensions For the matrix in the stock widget to display it correctly, a size and a color dimension can't be assigned to the same axis, like both vertical or horizontal. You need one horizon and the other to be vertical Then the widget will show the variants correctly
description:
Display of sizes and colors in stock widget

Tuesday, 21 February 2023

10:32

 

In case the customer reports that the POS doesn't show the color and sizes correctly in the stock widget

 

 

 

The settings of the dimension template for the products needs to be checked in Imagine
 Inventory --> Itemoverview --> Matrix --> Dimensions

 

 

For the matrix in the stock widget to display it correctly, a size and a color dimension can't be assigned to the same axis, like both vertical or horizontal. You need one horizon and the other to be vertical

 

 

 

Then the widget will show the variants correctly

title: Find Tenant info
text: Find Tenant info 27 May 2022 15:09 Imagine Portal (k3imagine.com) To find the Tenant ID of a Tenant you're logged into access dev tools (in Chrome right-click > inspect) and navigate to the 'Application' tab. On the left-hand menu expand the cookies section and find https://portal.k3imagine.com. Click on this to find the tenant ID displayed on the right.
description:
Find Tenant info

27 May 2022

15:09

 

Imagine Portal (k3imagine.com)

 

 

To find the Tenant ID of a Tenant you're logged into access dev tools (in Chrome right-click > inspect) and navigate to the 'Application' tab.

 

On the left-hand menu expand the cookies section and find https://portal.k3imagine.com. Click on this to find the tenant ID displayed on the right.

title: ID value discrepancies
text: ID value discrepancies 27 January 2023 4:04 PM Imagine uses a concept of Master Items and Variant Items. For example a T-Shirt may come in variants of Red, White and Blue. The Master item may be called TS001. When the Master Item is created it will be allocated a sequential ‘Item Number’ and ‘ItemID’. If this was the very first item ever created in a tenant then the Master Item’s Item Number would be ‘00000001’ and it’s internal ‘ItemID’ would be ‘1’ When the variant items are created they would also be allocated a sequential ‘Item Number’ and ‘ItemID’ but also a sequential ‘Barcode’. The sequential ‘Item Number’ is taken from the same sequence as the Master Item but the ‘ItemID’ and ‘Barcode’ are taken from different sequential pools. So, Item Number Master ItemID(internal) Variant ItemID(Internal) Barcode Master Item 000001 1 n/a n/a Red Variant 000002 1 1 200000000001 White Variant 000003 1 2 200000000002 Blue Variant 000004 1 3 200000000003 An Item which does not come in variations is represented as a Master Item but with only a single variant and follows the same flow in the allocation of Item Number, ItemID and Barcode. The ItemID and Master ItemID are internally generated numbers (Table PKs) and do not necessarily stay in sync with the item numbers and barcodes. Indeed, Item Numbers and barcodes do not also stay in sync. For the purposes of the BI-Gateway the itemid is the primary key for an item. This is reflected in the product, transaction, inventory etc end points.
description:
ID value discrepancies 

27 January 2023

4:04 PM

Imagine uses a concept of Master Items and Variant Items. For example a T-Shirt may come in variants of Red, White and Blue. The Master item may be called TS001. 

When the Master Item is created it will be allocated a sequential ‘Item Number’ and ‘ItemID’. If this was the very first item ever created in a tenant then the Master Item’s Item Number would be ‘00000001’ and it’s internal ‘ItemID’ would be ‘1’   

When the variant items are created they would also be allocated a sequential ‘Item Number’ and ‘ItemID’ but also a sequential ‘Barcode’. The sequential ‘Item Number’ is taken from the same sequence as the Master Item but the ‘ItemID’ and ‘Barcode’ are taken from different sequential pools. So,

 

Item Number   Master ItemID(internal)           Variant ItemID(Internal)            Barcode

Master Item     000001            1                                              n/a                                           n/a

Red Variant     000002            1                                              1                                              200000000001  

White Variant  000003            1                                              2                                              200000000002  

Blue Variant    000004            1                                              3                                              200000000003  

 

An Item which does not come in variations is represented as a Master Item but with only a single variant and follows the same flow in the allocation of Item Number, ItemID and Barcode.

 

 

 

 

 

 

The ItemID and Master ItemID are internally generated numbers (Table PKs) and do not necessarily stay in sync with the item numbers and barcodes. Indeed, Item Numbers and barcodes do not also stay in sync.

 

For the purposes of the BI-Gateway the itemid is the primary key for an item. This is reflected in the product, transaction, inventory etc end points.

title: Item Import validation fails on language browser
text: Item Import validation fails on language browser woensdag 19 april 2023 16:59 If a item-import fails on the validation, but you are sure that all columns are filled correctly then check the language of your browser. In case the browser is set for example on language Dutch, the import will alwasy try to add the items prices with a decimal comma instead of a dot. First change the language of your browser Find the settings of your Browser. (Below example for Chrome) Choose Languages Choose English by selecting the three dots Close and Restart your brwoser again Then start over again the import process first by with downloading the Import-Template. Now the validation will succeed.
description:
Item Import validation fails on language browser

woensdag 19 april 2023

16:59

If a item-import fails on the validation, but you are sure that all columns are filled correctly then check the language of your browser.

 

 

In case the browser is set for example on language Dutch, the import will alwasy try to add the items prices with a decimal comma instead of a dot.

 

First change the language of your browser

 

Find the settings of your Browser. (Below example for Chrome)

 

Choose Languages

 

 

 

Choose English by selecting the three dots

 

 

Close and Restart your brwoser again

 

Then start over again the import process first by with downloading the Import-Template.

Now the validation will succeed.

title: Item Inventory
text: Item Inventory 15. november 2022 14:16 How to check the inventory of a singel item: Through Item List Log into your portal Inventory Item List Fill in From-To Dates, Movement Type, Shop and Item and click Search Through Stock Lookup Log into your portal Inventory Stock Lookup Choose shop if there are more Choose Item from list or search for it Choose Adjustments - this will show you the current stock
description:
Item Inventory

15. november 2022

14:16

How to check the inventory of a singel item:

 

Through Item List

 

  1. Log into your portal
  2. Inventory
  3. Item List
  4. Fill in From-To Dates, Movement Type, Shop and Item and click Search

 

 

Through Stock Lookup

 

  1. Log into your portal
  2. Inventory
  3. Stock Lookup
  4. Choose shop if there are more
  5. Choose Item from list or search for it

 

 

  1. Choose Adjustments - this will show you the current stock

title: Minus in front of amount – how
text: Minus in front of amount – how? 27 May 2022 15:21 In case of a cash return, they first have to add the amount (or scan the item) and then press the return button to get a minus in front of the number. This can NOT be done manually. It won't work and will end with an error message.
description:
Minus in front of amount – how?

27 May 2022

15:21

 

In case of a cash return, they first have to add the amount (or scan the item) and then press the return button to get a minus in front of the number. This can NOT be done manually. It won't work and will end with an error message.

title: Process Manual EFT Transaction on P400 (Imagine)
text: Process Manual EFT Transaction on P400 (Imagine) 15 September 2022 12:37 Please see below for how to do a manual transaction on the P400s – in this case, a refund Press * key on PinPad Supervisor Password: 12345 Select “Configuration” Supervisor Password: 12345 Select “POS” Select “Enable/Disable POS” Select Tick on the prompt to disable POS This will take the PED back to the main screen where instead of waiting for Merchant login, it will now say to enter login details Press green Tick on screen to get to the login screen Enter the users Login ID Press Tick on screen Enter the user Login PIN/Password Press Tick on screen This will now log you in and you will see the Sale screen – asking you to enter a value Press * Select “Card Not Present” Select “Refund Telephone Order” Enter the value to be refunded Press Tick on screen Merchant Reference isn’t need but can be entered if wanted Press Tick on screen – even if blank Enter Card Number Press Tick on screen Enter Expiry date of card Press Tick on screen Enter CSC Code from back of Card Press Tick on screen Say no to register for account on file if prompted This will now process the refund – for Sales you will also be prompted for first line of address, postcode and present you with the normal data match/not match etc and give you the option of whether to proceed if the data doesn’t match…this is not needed for refunds though After the transaction it will say Printer Not Attached – Press the red cross as you cannot print receipts Now you need to put the Ped back into POS mode Press * Press the Down icon to go down the menu page Select “Configuration” Supervisor Password: 12345 Select “POS” Select “Enable/Disable POS” Select Tick on the prompt to Enable POS You will now be taken back to the Waiting for Merchant Login screen – either wait for the connector to log the PED back in, or reboot the connector/restart the K3_Pay service on the connector
description:
Process Manual EFT Transaction on P400 (Imagine)

15 September 2022

12:37

 

Please see below for how to do a manual transaction on the P400s – in this case, a refund

 

Press * key on PinPad

Supervisor Password: 12345

Select “Configuration”

Supervisor Password: 12345

Select “POS”

Select “Enable/Disable POS”

Select Tick on the prompt to disable POS

 

This will take the PED back to the main screen where instead of waiting for Merchant login, it will now say to enter login details

 

Press green Tick on screen to get to the login screen

Enter the users Login ID

Press Tick on screen

Enter the user Login PIN/Password

Press Tick on screen

 

This will now log you in and you will see the Sale screen – asking you to enter a value

 

Press *

Select “Card Not Present”

Select “Refund Telephone Order”

Enter the value to be refunded

Press Tick on screen

Merchant Reference isn’t need but can be entered if wanted

Press Tick on screen – even if blank

Enter Card Number

Press Tick on screen

Enter Expiry date of card

Press Tick on screen

Enter CSC Code from back of Card

Press Tick on screen

Say no to register for account on file if prompted

This will now process the refund – for Sales you will also be prompted for first line of address, postcode and present you with the normal data match/not match etc and give you the option of whether to proceed if the data doesn’t match…this is not needed for refunds though

After the transaction it will say Printer Not Attached – Press the red cross as you cannot print receipts

 

Now you need to put the Ped back into POS mode

 

Press *

Press the Down icon to go down the menu page

Select “Configuration”

Supervisor Password: 12345

Select “POS”

Select “Enable/Disable POS”

Select Tick on the prompt to Enable POS

 

You will now be taken back to the Waiting for Merchant Login screen – either wait for the connector to log the PED back in, or reboot the connector/restart the K3_Pay service on the connector

title: Removing Nets Card Terminal Actions for UK P400 Ped use
text: Removing Nets Card Terminal Actions for UK P400 Ped use 26 September 2022 14:19 By Default most Imagine Pos setups will have the Nets "Card Terminal Actions" set to display on the Pos. This menu only applies to the European Nets card terminal setup and does not work with the UK P400 card terminals and furthermore if used can cause both confusion for customers and also cause issues with the P400 Ped. The Nets menu is shown as below. The way to remove this menu is to go into the Admin module and select "Button Setup" this will bring up the selection page where you should look for "Aside Functions", deselect "card terminal actions" as below. Deselecting this will stop the Terminal Actions menu appearing.
description:
Removing Nets Card Terminal Actions for UK P400 Ped use

26 September 2022

14:19

By Default most Imagine Pos setups will have the Nets "Card Terminal Actions" set to display on the Pos. This menu only applies to the European Nets card terminal setup and does not work with the UK P400 card terminals and furthermore if used can cause both confusion for customers and also cause issues with the P400 Ped.

The Nets menu is shown as below.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The way to remove this menu is to go into the Admin module and select "Button Setup" this will bring up the selection page where you should look for "Aside Functions", deselect "card terminal actions" as below.

 

 

 

 

Deselecting this will stop the Terminal Actions menu appearing.

title: Reports error query returns too many records fix
text: Reports error "query returns too many records" fix 26 January 2023 09:24 If you get an error as below when running reports from the Analysis module there is a setting in Portal/Configuration in the customers Tenant. Set this number to something higher than the error message limit gives and they should run ok. These limits are set to minimise the time it takes to run reports.
description:
Reports error "query returns too many records" fix

26 January 2023

09:24

 

If you get an error as below when running reports from the Analysis module there is a setting in Portal/Configuration in the customers Tenant.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Set this number to something higher than the error message limit gives and they should run ok. These limits are set to minimise the time it takes to run reports.

title: Reprint a receipt
text: Reprint a receipt 08 August 2022 10:06 In the event of a receipt reprint being requested there are mainly 2 methods. "Reprint Last" is the easiest if the reprint is required immediately after the transaction has gone through and no other transactions have occurred since. This button is visible as soon as you log into the Pos. "Find Receipt" is a more accurate way of getting the exact receipt you want as it will bring up all the receipts and let you see in detail the receipt before re printing. By selecting the receipt and then pressing "reprint last" this will reprint the receipt. As you can see you can also elect to email the receipt, or return or print a Gift receipt. There is also a complete Journal printout function which will print the complete journal for the selected date. This will of course print everything for that day. This is accessed by the 3 dots and "Journals" button.
description:
Reprint a receipt

08 August 2022

10:06

 

In the event of a receipt reprint being requested there are mainly 2 methods.

 

  1. "Reprint Last" is the easiest if the reprint is required immediately after the transaction has gone through and no other transactions have occurred since. This button is visible as soon as you log into the Pos.

 

 

  1. "Find Receipt" is a more accurate way of getting the exact receipt you want as it will bring up all the receipts and let you see in detail the receipt before re printing. By selecting the receipt and then pressing "reprint last" this will reprint the receipt. As you can see you can also elect to email the receipt, or return or print a Gift receipt.

 

 

  1. There is also a complete Journal printout function which will print the complete journal for the selected date. This will of course print everything for that day.

This is accessed by the 3 dots and "Journals" button.

title: Return an item with a receipt
text: Return an item with a receipt 27 May 2022 15:30 Scan the receipt Choose payment type Press accept Do NOT add a minus (-) in front of the amount manually.
description:
Return an item with a receipt

27 May 2022

15:30

 

  1. Scan the receipt
  2. Choose payment type
  3. Press accept

 

Do NOT add a minus (-) in front of the amount manually.

title: Kiosk Self Checkout - SCO Supervisor Panel
text: SCO Supervisor Panel 20 July 2022 15:20 You can access the SCO Supervisor Panel by typing '1111' followed by the enter key. This replicates scanning a barcode of '1111' The Supervisor Panel is used for various tasks such as changing the connector (payment device) the SCO is using, cancelling/editing transactions, disabling payments for testing etc. The supervisor barcode is also required to be entered when the SCO goes into 'Help' mode:

20 July 2022

15:20

 

You can access the SCO Supervisor Panel by typing '1111' followed by the enter key. This replicates scanning a barcode of '1111'

 

The Supervisor Panel is used for various tasks such as changing the connector (payment device) the SCO is using, cancelling/editing transactions, disabling payments for testing etc.

 

 

The supervisor barcode is also required to be entered when the SCO goes into 'Help' mode:

title: Set up Item Info codes
text: Set up Item Info codes 29 October 2022 11:17 Instructions on setting up Item Info codes in Imagine These prompts or messages can be setup using a combination of Custom Attribute and Item Info. In an example below we will set a question to appear on screen when the Item is added to a transaction which then prompts the cashier to verify the customers age. Firstly set a Custom Attribute as below Once this is saved then open the Backoffice module and setup the Item Info as below Once saved you now have to link the Item to the Custom Attribute. Bring up the Item List and search for the Item and click on the Custom Attributes Tab as below. Now you can test the Item Info against the Item by adding it to the transaction in the Pos and you should now be prompted as below.

title: Suppress automatic receipt printing in Imagine
text: Suppress automatic receipt printing in Imagine 26 July 2022 13:52 Customers can request for automatic printing of the receipt to be switched off so that receipt printing will only occur if "Print Receipt" button is pressed. This is usually implemented where customers don't want to waste paper unnecessarily. Once logged into the customers Tenant, navigate to the PosAdmin module and select Pos Options. The screen will look as below. Tick the box circled in red to suppress receipt printing. The other options here are also modifiable if desired.

title: Assigning POS to a teenant user
text: All tenats in imagine have system user accounts which they use to login into Imagine backoffice portal. A user may have access to a particular pos or shop and can request to have access to more shops that belong to their tenat. For example as shared below,this user has access to four shops in his tenat. if a customer calls that they want to add a shop to a user account,so it can only be configured by a platform admin account. Login to imagine portal Go to platform admin Select tenats and choose the one you want to make changes, Select user account from the list. Select Pos and click on it so you will see a list of pos/shops that can be added or removed. Select the pos you want to add and click save. Now the user will have access to the appropriate pos-shop. As shown,Clicking on the pos shows you a list of available pos-shops that you can add or remove according to the request. Remember to save it and then save it on the user account also to make the changes effective. Now the user is configured and can access to above available 4 shops.
description:
All tenats in imagine have system user accounts which they use to login into Imagine backoffice portal.

A user may have access to a particular pos or shop and can request to have access to more shops that belong to their tenat.

For example as shared below,this user has access to four shops in his tenat.



if a customer calls that they want to add a shop to a user account,so it can only be configured by a platform admin account.

Login to imagine portal
Go to platform admin
Select tenats and choose the one you want to make changes,
Select user account from the list.

Select Pos and click on it so you will see a list of pos/shops that can be added or removed.

Select the pos you want to add and click save.

Now the user will have access to the appropriate pos-shop.


As shown,Clicking on the pos shows you a list of available pos-shops that you can add or remove according to the request.



Remember to save it and then save it on the user account also to make the changes effective.
Now the user is configured and can access to above available 4 shops.

title: ZReport Data Not Fully Retrieved in SQL
text: SQL Server Management Studio has a limit in the amount of data that can be returned to the results grid. As the ZReport data is quite large this often exceeds the default limit. The limit can be increased to include the entire ZReport data by doing the following: 1. Open SSMS and connect to your SQL Server instance. 2. Go to "Tools" in the menu bar. 3. Select "Options" from the dropdown menu. 4. In the Options window, navigate to "Query Results" -> "SQL Server" -> "Results to Grid" (or "Results to Text"). 5. Look for the "Maximum Characters Retrieved" option. 6. Increase the value to the desired maximum number of characters.
description:
SQL Server Management Studio has a limit in the amount of data that can be returned to the results grid. As the ZReport data is quite large this often exceeds the default limit.


The limit can be increased to include the entire ZReport data by doing the following:

1. Open SSMS and connect to your SQL Server instance.
2. Go to "Tools" in the menu bar.
3. Select "Options" from the dropdown menu.
4. In the Options window, navigate to "Query Results" -> "SQL Server" -> "Results to Grid" (or "Results to Text").
5. Look for the "Maximum Characters Retrieved" option.
6. Increase the value to the desired maximum number of characters.

title: Credit Limit exceedes: POS comes with a credit limit error.
text: When we receive a call from an imagine customer that they get the following error when they try to enter the webshop. The error explains that the allowed limit has been exceeded for that account. The example is shared as below where we can observe that the error comes for WEBSHOP CTO10705. The solution for such problem is to login to the customer account using dddsupp login details for that customer. After login Go to customer module. Then locate the webshop id which is in this case werbshop CTO10705 Go to Account menu and activate Unbound credit Limit by changing it from OFF to ON Make a hard refresh on the POS by CTRL+F5 and ask the clerk again if the error has been resolved.
description:
When we receive a call from an imagine customer that they get the following error when they try to enter the webshop.
The error explains that the allowed limit has been exceeded for that account.

The example is shared as below where we can observe that the error comes for WEBSHOP CTO10705.


The solution for such problem is to login to the customer account using dddsupp login details for that customer.

After login Go to customer module.

Then locate the webshop id which is in this case werbshop CTO10705

Go to Account menu and activate Unbound credit Limit by changing it from OFF to ON

Make a hard refresh on the POS by CTRL+F5 and ask the clerk again if the error has been resolved.

title: Changing Customer Display Image
text: Firstly, when logged into Imagine go to POS Admin > POS Options and click on Add (See image below) Upon clicking on Add, you will see multiple options to add an image, you can either upload an image from your personal library/PC or you can add a link from internet that links to an image. (see image below) After you're done click on Add once again on the right bottom and you're set.
description:
Firstly, when logged into Imagine go to POS Admin > POS Options and click on Add (See image below)



Upon clicking on Add, you will see multiple options to add an image, you can either upload an image from your personal library/PC or you can add a link from internet that links to an image. (see image below)


After you're done click on Add once again on the right bottom and you're set.

title: Importing/Exporting a HAR File
text: When passing a ticket to Dev you may be required to export a HAR file from Dev Tools. To export: Navigate to the Network tab in dev tools and ensure your error is captured. Click on the export arrow to save the file locally. To import: Open a new tab on your browser. Open dev tools and navigate to the network tab. Click the import button and select the file to Import.
description:
When passing a ticket to Dev you may be required to export a HAR file from Dev Tools.


To export: 

  • Navigate to the Network tab in dev tools and ensure your error is captured.
  • Click on the export arrow to save the file locally.

To import:

  • Open a new tab on your browser.
  • Open dev tools and navigate to the network tab.
  • Click the import button and select the file to Import.

title: Guide to Gathering Info for Imagine Issues
text: Here are some hints and tips for investigations into Imagine issues. Certainly before passing a ticket to Dev ensure that FLS have performed basic checks such as: Ensuring the POS is running the latest version. See POS User Interface for info on how to check POS version. Power cycle of the Till, Connector & Card Terminal (if issue with POS/Payments). See Connector Articles - Restart connector for info on how to restart the connector. Checking cable connections & till-roll in printer. Once basic triage has been completed, SLS will need to gain detailed information on the issue. The Network Tab on Chrome dev tools or the network request view in LogRocket is a great way of knowing where an error has occurred. If the failed network request is pointing to an Imagine URL this is most likely an issue with Imagine itself. If the failed network request is pointing to an IP address this will point to an issue on the connector. Further details from the connector can be found by reading the relevant docker containers log file. The response from the failed request may help point you to a possible resolution that may not require dev intervention. See HTTP Status Codes for a definition of HTTP status codes. Make sure if you want help from others (e.g. Development), that you explain fully what you've done, what your evaluation of that info is (don't just pass a log file or screenshot) Good examples of details to send to Dev include (try to include as many of these as possible): Screenshots of any errors that may occur. Replication steps (if applicable). Export of Chrome Dev Tools Network tab/LogRocket session detailing the issue. See Importing/Exporting a HAR File for information on how to export a HAR file from Chrome. LogRocket sessions can be quite lengthy. Try to utilise the crop feature to isolate the error to make it easier to navigate. Details of exactly where an error occurs in the process. E.g. if issue related to transactions, does the error occur after payment has gone through on the card terminal, or before, etc. Screenshots of relevant Connector log files. See Connector Articles - Accessing Docker Logs for information on how to read connector logs. Details of error from microservice logs. See Imagine Microservice Logs (Grafana) for information on how to query the Imagine platform logs. Remember that if you do pass a ticket to Dev, that screenshots/images need to be passed as attachments (not pasted in-line because the integration only sends over plain text, although you can do both for clarity in FD if you want to)
description:
Here are some hints and tips for investigations into Imagine issues. Certainly before passing a ticket to Dev ensure that FLS have performed basic checks such as: 

  • Ensuring the POS is running the latest version.
    • See POS User Interface for info on how to check POS version.
  • Power cycle of the Till, Connector & Card Terminal (if issue with POS/Payments).
    • See Connector Articles - Restart connector for info on how to restart the connector.
  • Checking cable connections & till-roll in printer.

 

Once basic triage has been completed, SLS will need to gain detailed information on the issue.


The Network Tab on Chrome dev tools or the network request view in LogRocket is a great way of knowing where an error has occurred.

  • If the failed network request is pointing to an Imagine URL this is most likely an issue with Imagine itself.
  • If the failed network request is pointing to an IP address this will point to an issue on the connector.
  • Further details from the connector can be found by reading the relevant docker containers log file.


The response from the failed request may help point you to a possible resolution that may not require dev intervention. See HTTP Status Codes for a definition of HTTP status codes.


Make sure if you want help from others (e.g. Development), that you explain fully what you've done, what your evaluation of that info is (don't just pass a log file or screenshot)


Good examples of details to send to Dev include (try to include as many of these as possible):

  • Screenshots of any errors that may occur.
  • Replication steps (if applicable).
  • Export of Chrome Dev Tools Network tab/LogRocket session detailing the issue.
    • See Importing/Exporting a HAR File for information on how to export a HAR file from Chrome.
    • LogRocket sessions can be quite lengthy. Try to utilise the crop feature to isolate the error to make it easier to navigate.
  • Details of exactly where an error occurs in the process.
    • E.g. if issue related to transactions, does the error occur after payment has gone through on the card terminal, or before, etc.
  • Screenshots of relevant Connector log files.
    • See Connector Articles - Accessing Docker Logs for information on how to read connector logs.
  • Details of error from microservice logs.
    • See Imagine Microservice Logs (Grafana) for information on how to query the Imagine platform logs.


Remember that if you do pass a ticket to Dev, that screenshots/images need to be passed as attachments (not pasted in-line because the integration only sends over plain text, although you can do both for clarity in FD if you want to)

title: HTTP Status Codes
text: Status code Meaning 1xx Informational 100 Continue 101 Switching protocols 102 Processing 103 Early Hints 2xx Succesful 200 OK 201 Created 202 Accepted 203 Non-Authoritative Information 204 No Content 205 Reset Content 206 Partial Content 207 Multi-Status 208 Already Reported 226 IM Used 3xx Redirection 300 Multiple Choices 301 Moved Permanently 302 Found (Previously "Moved Temporarily") 303 See Other 304 Not Modified 305 Use Proxy 306 Switch Proxy 307 Temporary Redirect 308 Permanent Redirect 4xx Client Error 400 Bad Request 401 Unauthorized 402 Payment Required 403 Forbidden 404 Not Found 405 Method Not Allowed 406 Not Acceptable 407 Proxy Authentication Required 408 Request Timeout 409 Conflict 410 Gone 411 Length Required 412 Precondition Failed 413 Payload Too Large 414 URI Too Long 415 Unsupported Media Type 416 Range Not Satisfiable 417 Expectation Failed 418 I'm a Teapot 421 Misdirected Request 422 Unprocessable Entity 423 Locked 424 Failed Dependency 425 Too Early 426 Upgrade Required 428 Precondition Required 429 Too Many Requests 431 Request Header Fields Too Large 451 Unavailable For Legal Reasons 5xx Server Error 500 Internal Server Error 501 Not Implemented 502 Bad Gateway 503 Service Unavailable 504 Gateway Timeout 505 HTTP Version Not Supported 506 Variant Also Negotiates 507 Insufficient Storage 508 Loop Detected 510 Not Extended 511 Network Authentication Required

title: Logrocket Introduction-Interface
text: Logrocket is basically a monitoring tool that allows us to watch user sessions which are recorded in the production. It show us a replay of what clerks/users did on the Imagine portal and can help the developers to inspect network requests and response logs. This is done in order to track some useful information in case of error tracking and help developers to identify and help them to solve issues. All Imagine customers are usually enabled for logrocket sessions in platform admin. To get access to logrocket application, a support agent must be invited by logrocket admin account. The agent receives the invitation by email and when accepted the support agent can login to the account and can track recording sessions for every respective active client. The logrocket dashboard screen shot is shared as below. In search bar we can filter our search on the basis of different parameters. Every session shows us the user details and also the date and time of that session. We can also customize time range for the sessions in order to find a specific date or interval. When a customer reports an issue, we can search the user by different parameters user id,name,email and location etc. In relation to Imagine, we normally search a customer by their tenant id which in this case is a UserID as shown for that customer in platform admin. In this example, we are using user id that contains 250.It allows us to track all the recordings for UserID 250 for all their stores/shops. We can track a specific data and time reported by the customer and can explore it further. When a specific interval is tracked, the respective activity is clicked and it opens the corresponding recording with various monitoring information. The Network tab, Developer tools needs to be set active and one can track the error logs by observing the small red bars in the play video session. In this case Error 400 is observed as red and is bad request and directs the developer team to explore further the problem relating to Infrasec Integration.
description:
Logrocket is basically a monitoring tool that allows us to watch user sessions which are recorded in the production.


It show us a replay of what clerks/users did on the Imagine portal and can help the developers to inspect network requests and response logs. This is done in order to track some useful information in case of error tracking and help developers to identify and help them to solve issues.

All Imagine customers are usually enabled for logrocket sessions in platform admin.


To get access to logrocket application, a support agent must be invited by logrocket admin account.

The agent receives the invitation by email and when accepted the support agent can login to the account and can track recording sessions for every respective active client.



The logrocket dashboard screen shot is shared as below.
In search bar we can filter our search on the basis of different parameters.
Every session shows us the user details and also the date and time of that session.
We can also customize time range for the sessions in order to find a specific date or interval.




When a customer reports an issue, we can search the user by different parameters  user id,name,email and location etc.

In relation to Imagine, we normally search a customer by their tenant id which in this case is a UserID as shown for that customer in platform admin.
In this example, we are using user id  that contains 250.It allows us to track all the recordings for UserID 250 for all their stores/shops. We can track a specific data and time reported by the customer and can explore it further.



When a specific interval is tracked, the respective activity is clicked and it opens the corresponding recording with various monitoring information. The Network tab, Developer tools needs to be set active and one can track the error logs by observing the small red bars in the play video session.

In this case Error 400 is observed as red and is bad request and directs the developer team to explore further the problem relating to Infrasec Integration.

title: Imagine Microservice Logs (Grafana)
text: Grafana is a tool that allows you to view the logs that come directly out of the various microservices within Imagine. Errors from Grafana are especially useful for the Dev team as they will typically include the code error which will point to the exact lines of code the error occurred in and a more comprehensive explanation. This gives a lot more detail than the simple toast errors in Imagine or even the request response from Dev tools/LogRocket. For an introduction please see Grafana Training Video The Grafana stats page can be accessed at https://grafana.k3imagine.com/ and logged into with the following credentials: Username: support Password: Ret@il123.! Grafana runs in two environments (as noted in the top left of the welcome page), these environments are: K8S002 - Imagine non-production environment (i.e. RC, Dev, Test). K8S003 - Imagine production environment. To start building a query navigate to the explore section from the burger menu in the top left: The first step is to ensure you're querying within Loki (as noted by the drop-down in the top left) and add a label filter for "namespace = im-prod": Within the Kubernetes cluster everything is separated out into namespaces. All of the Imagine services reside in the "im-prod" namespace so this is the only one we're interested in for Imagine. In the top right there is a date/time filter that can be applied to your query. Please note however, logs are only stored for 7 days: If you were to run this query as is you'll notice a graph detailing the volume of logs below your query editor over your set timeframe and further down the text output of the logs. Since we're only filtering on the im-prod namespace this will return lots of data and further filtering will most likely be required to find exactly what you're after. The type of filtering needed will depend on the type of issue you're trying to investigate. A good start is to filter only to errors. You can do this by adding "exception" into your line contains filter: You can then filter down further by adding the Tenant ID into the query. To do this you'll need to add two more line filters for "tenantid" and another for the specific Tenant ID you're searching for: Most but not ALL services include the Tenant ID in the logs. Therefore, if you can't find a specific error it doesn't necessarily mean it's not that but simply may not include Tenant ID. Try removing or changing some filters. Once you're happy with your query filters simply click the "Run Query" button to execute it. In the logs section, enable the "Prettify JSON" option to make this more readable: You'll then see the logs that match your filtering criteria in JSON format: If collating this information for Dev, include the entire error message from the "@x" key. The Request Path, if available is also useful information to include.
description:
Grafana is a tool that allows you to view the logs that come directly out of the various microservices within Imagine. Errors from Grafana are especially useful for the Dev team as they will typically include the code error which will point to the exact lines of code the error occurred in and a more comprehensive explanation. This gives a lot more detail than the simple toast errors in Imagine or even the request response from Dev tools/LogRocket.


For an introduction please see Grafana Training Video



The Grafana stats page can be accessed at https://grafana.k3imagine.com/ and logged into with the following credentials:

Username: support

Password: Ret@il123.!


Grafana runs in two environments (as noted in the top left of the welcome page), these environments are:

  • K8S002 - Imagine non-production environment (i.e. RC, Dev, Test).
  • K8S003 - Imagine production environment.


To start building a query navigate to the explore section from the burger menu in the top left:


The first step is to ensure you're querying within Loki (as noted by the drop-down in the top left) and add a label filter for "namespace = im-prod":


Within the Kubernetes cluster everything is separated out into namespaces. All of the Imagine services reside in the "im-prod" namespace so this is the only one we're interested in for Imagine.


In the top right there is a date/time filter that can be applied to your query. Please note however, logs are only stored for 7 days:


If you were to run this query as is you'll notice a graph detailing the volume of logs below your query editor over your set timeframe and further down the text output of the logs. Since we're only filtering on the im-prod namespace this will return lots of data and further filtering will most likely be required to find exactly what you're after.


The type of filtering needed will depend on the type of issue you're trying to investigate. A good start is to filter only to errors. You can do this by adding "exception" into your line contains filter:


You can then filter down further by adding the Tenant ID into the query. To do this you'll need to add two more line filters for "tenantid" and another for the specific Tenant ID you're searching for:


Most but not ALL services include the Tenant ID in the logs. Therefore, if you can't find a specific error it doesn't necessarily mean it's not that but simply may not include Tenant ID. Try removing or changing some filters.


Once you're happy with your query filters simply click the "Run Query" button to execute it. In the logs section, enable the "Prettify JSON" option to make this more readable:


You'll then see the logs that match your filtering criteria in JSON format:


If collating this information for Dev, include the entire error message from the "@x" key. The Request Path, if available is also useful information to include.

title: Copy/paste in imagine
text: If youre having trouble pasting in a barcode/product name etc. anywhere in the imagine POS, its most likely because you havent given the imagine site access to the clipboard. First time, the browser should ask for your permission, like shown below. In case the browser has already been denied access, you will have to find the clipboard option and toggle it to allow sharing of the clipboard.
description:
If youre having trouble pasting in a barcode/product name etc. anywhere in the imagine POS, its most likely because you havent given the imagine site access to the clipboard. 


First time, the browser should ask for your permission, like shown below.



In case the browser has already been denied access, you will have to find the clipboard option and toggle it to allow sharing of the clipboard.

title: Change language in the Imagine POS
text: The language of the Imagine POS is not tied to the language of the store in general, its tied to the individual clerk. When adding a clerk in backoffice, take not of the language. If you want to change the language you can simply edit the language of the clerk whenever
description:
The language of the Imagine POS is not tied to the language of the store in general, its tied to the individual clerk. 


When adding a clerk in backoffice, take not of the language. If you want to change the language you can simply edit the language of the clerk whenever

title: Create shortcut for items on POS.
text: Sometime,the store contact us and ask for support creating shortcuts for the items that they need to use it frequently. For example,the most common item that is taken into consideration is plastic bags-Poser. It makes the clerk job easier to add that item to the ongoing purchase by selecting it from the menu shortcut. The desired item needs to be first traced in backoffice under menu Inventory-->item list Then select the parametre Matrix where one can choose an ON-OFF button in order to activate or deactivate shortcut for the specific item. The example taken here is poser. When the button Genvej is made active for the item poser,It should be visible on the pos under the menu shortcut as shown below.
description:
Sometime,the store contact us and ask for support creating shortcuts for the items that they need to use it frequently.

For example,the most common item that is taken into consideration is plastic bags-Poser.

It makes the clerk job easier to add that item to the ongoing purchase by selecting it from the menu shortcut.

The desired item needs to be first traced in backoffice under menu
Inventory-->item list
Then select the parametre Matrix where one can choose an ON-OFF button in order to activate or deactivate shortcut for the specific item.

The example taken here is poser.




When the button Genvej is made active for the item poser,It should be visible on the pos under the menu shortcut as shown below.

title: Cash payment limitation
text: If you want to set a limit for cash payment amount to a certain value, you can do that under POS Options, Options Enable a maximum cash payment and add an amount:
description:
If you want to set a limit for cash payment amount to a certain value, you can do that under POS Options, Options 

Enable a maximum cash payment and add an amount:

title: Imagine DB Purchase Order Status Definitions
text: PO's can have multiple order statues that are reflected in the database as a number. The numbers correlate to the following statuses: 0 - Draft 1 - Placed 2 - Partly Received 3 - Complete 4 - Cancelled 5 - Cancelled - Partly Received
description:
PO's can have multiple order statues that are reflected in the database as a number. The numbers correlate to the following statuses:

0 - Draft

1 - Placed

2 - Partly Received

3 - Complete

4 - Cancelled

5 - Cancelled - Partly Received

title: New Oxhoo printer-Activation in Imagine Portal.
text: The k3 printers are being replaced by new oxhoo TP85 printers.The development team has done the configuation for the new printer and when connected to the imagine connector,it needs to be selected from K3connector Manger in Imagine portal. The path is as follows Login to Imagine portal choose POS admin menu and then choose k3 connector manager. click on edit and choose the requested oxhoo printer from the printers list. Click on save as shown below in the screenshots and the printer should now work with the imagine connector,Otherwise it is also a good idea to restart the connector before testing a receipt from receipt printer.
description:
The k3 printers are being replaced by new oxhoo TP85 printers.The development team has done the configuation for the new printer and when connected to the imagine connector,it needs to be selected from K3connector Manger in Imagine portal.

The path is as follows
Login to Imagine portal
choose POS admin menu
and then choose k3 connector manager.

click on edit and choose the requested oxhoo printer from the printers list.

Click on save as shown below in the screenshots and the printer should now work with the imagine connector,Otherwise it is also a good idea to restart the connector before testing a receipt from receipt printer.

title: Oxhoo printer-Connection Interface Imagine.
text: The oxhoo printer is using the same interface as k3 printers. The receipt printer must be connected to imagine connector via USB to com port cable. The usb end of the cable is connected to the first usb port on the connector and the other end (COM) needs to be inserted in the com port available on the oxhoo printer. Of course,There is also a power cable/adapter that needs to be powered into the receipt printer as shown in the below screenshot.
description:
The oxhoo printer is using the same interface as k3 printers.

The receipt printer must be connected to imagine connector via USB to com port cable.

The usb end of the cable is connected to the first usb port on the connector and the other end (COM) needs to be inserted in the com port available on the oxhoo printer.

Of course,There is also a power cable/adapter that needs to be powered into the receipt printer as shown in the below screenshot.
